page.title: 14Cheese Making.
page.content: Making {Cheshire Cheese }is quite a complicated process.It used to be done on the farms, but now it is made in special factories. First,milk is heated to 71 degrees centigrade to pasteurise it. Then special bacteria are added and the milk is cooled . The milk now begins to get lumpy and turns into{curds and whey}.The {curds}are separated from the {whey}and the {whey is taken away to use as pig food.The { {curds }are mixed with a bit of salt and then they are pressed in big moulds that are lined with cheese clothes. Very heavy weights are used to press the cheese into shape. After it is pressed it is wrapped in plastic and then stored for a couple of weeks. Nowdays our local farms produce milk for more modern types of cheese such as {Lymeswold.}
